Rebecca was really cute and a lot of fun. She's doing graduate work in history and really knows her stuff. Love a free walking tour and I tip pretty well.

Amazing food!! The servers were attentive and the food came out fast. Definitely recommend. We tried the S'mores French toast, grilled cheese (a must have!!!!) and the "all hail the omelette." I tried the mimosa with blueberries (not sure of the name), but so good!
I was attracted by the reviews which were enticing. The service was deficient by delivering the order by piecemeal and lukewarm food. Wrong choice.

Great shop! They have a lot of Specialized bikes at good prices--women's Vita was around $400. Definitely check them out if you are looking for a new bike. 

The guys are super friendly. The staff always offers to help when you walk in. I was looking for a rear rack basket (incredibly hard to find) and they had one style in stock. It wouldn't fit over my Topeak rack so the guy back in the mechanics shop cut away some of the springs so that it would fit over it, free of charge. I love that they are super accommodating and want to make sure everything works for you.

The owner of this location (and two others including Southampton) reached out to me after my previous review. We ended up talking for half an hour and I was very impressed with his approach to business... he's definitely the type of person I want to do business with. I returned to Saladworks on two separate occasions and the service had vastly improved. The new summer salads are wonderful!

I don't know why this place has such a low rating. The one in Vegas has 4.5 stars after nearly 1500 reviews!!

My friends kept RAVING to me about Earl of Sandwich (Vegas location) and I didn't really get what the hype was over a sandwich, so I never made much of an effort to go. I saw the EoS at Downtown Disney earlier in the day, but after a big breakfast and a Ghiradelli sundae, I just didn't have the room. The gods must have been smiling on me because then we happened upon EoS in Tampa! I could tell my mom wasn't that excited about it and was just indulging me by coming here, but after 1 bite she could not stop talking about how great it is. 

We split the club and the holiday special which was like Thanksgiving on a rectangular bun. It was filled with turkey, stuffing, gravy and cranberry and was as hefty as a brick, but a lot more delicious. The club was also really good and a lot less carb-y. They do an awesome job toasting up the sandwiches and heating them through.

Not super big, or super cheap at $10 (including chips and drink), but really very yummy. Can't wait until a location opens up in the LA/OC area!

Unfortunately I cannot give -5 stars!! I rarely eat fast food but I'm not hard to please as long as I get what I'm paying for. This has to be the nastiest restaurant I've ever stepped foot in and I was so surprised it was a Wendy's. I've never been to Wendy's and the food was not fresh....EVER!!!! Granted it's been probably a year or so since I've eaten Wendy's. If this is what they've become then I'll pass. The floors were sticky and slippery, the customer service was ok at best and the food taste like it was sitting for hours. There were two soft drink machines buy only one dispense ice and the other drink and both of those look like they were not cleaned since they powered it on. When I went to refill my mom's cup I noticed the ice dispenser had black mold, I assume. I did not refill and at that point we left. Everything was sticky to touch or broken.There was a little 3 yr old girl that slipped while her mum was holding her hand in the order line. This really discourage me even more from eating fast food which is probably a good thing!

It took me over a year after I moved to St. Louis to finally make the decision that I could not fly back to my home state of New Jersey every time I needed my hair cut and colored.  So I bid adieu to my stylist back home, and started my St. Louis search.  After asking a friend's mom, whose hair always looks fabulous, she pointed me to Studio Branaca, and my stylist Steve.

What a blessing!  He is an amazing stylist and all around good guy.  He really knows how to work with your hair and is honest about what he things will look good based on your face shape, coloring etc.  He also pointed me in the direction of Julie, my colorist.  Now I must digress and say that I trust my stylists totally...I mean that is their job, right.  So I put myself in their hands...which, with color, can be risky.  Well, there was nothing to worry about because Julie does great color...really thinking about the time of year, what you're looking for, etc.

I've recommend everyone that is looking for a new stylist to go here, you won't be disappointed.

I love this restaurant! Amazing food and amazing service! The owner is such a gem! So nice and treats his customers so kindly! Also, best salsa ever! I always get the pollo en mole! Definitely worth your time to check out!

I've been here twice. Once for a friend's birthday and this past weekend for my boyfriend's birthday/Valentines Day.

Let me start off by saying that the food is amazing. There were no complaints in that department. 

However, I had made reservations for the later seating over a month beforehand. Because of budget stuff and the fact that we live in the suburbs, we really don't get out for things like this often and were really looking forward to a little romantic dinner. We arrived in plenty of time for our reservation. But because of overcrowding, we had to sit communally with two other couples. I wouldn't be so upset about this if we were told ahead of time that there would be a chance of this happening, but they decided after having us sit there in our coats for 10 minutes and didn't really give us a decision in the matter. It really did put a damper on the evening. Luckily, the other two couples were great people and we had some great conversation. And they did serve us as three separate parties of two, so we weren't sharing the plate with a bunch of strangers. 

But then, they decided to include the mandatory 18% for parties of 6 or more despite billing and serving us separately, which was a huge slap in the face. Unfortunately, they lost out, because even when I tip low, I tip more than that.

I love to support smaller businesses and this restaurant is truly unique. But I can't help feel sour about our treatment there. You would think that after being in business for so long, they'd figure out how to handle situations like this. It really is unfortunate.

Ok so I went to this place several months ago, maybe January? And can't believe I haven't left a review yet. To be honest I don't remember the exact name of my dish but it was some type of truffle bucatini. There are no words. Just incredible. In full disclosure I'm a sucker for truffle anything, and pasta, so this was kind of a no brainer. Can't wait to go back now that it's nice out!

This is the place to take your car!

My Toyota broke down on me Wednesday. I needed to get my clutch replaced. The only thing is that I'm leaving early tomorrow morning (Saturday) to move out of town. You can imagine my stress. 

Buck himself was the one that helped me when I got my car towed there. I told him that I was moving so I was concerned about getting my car in time. He went above and beyond to make sure that I got my car this afternoon (Friday) which is so much more than I expected. 

Not only that, the price he gave me is at least $700 cheaper than the dealership priced it at. 

Needless to say I'm very happy I took my car here. These guys really seem to know what they're doing and you can tell they actually care about their customers.
This place is hot garbage. Never going back. Can't believe they let that dude Tristan walk. I felt as though he was the glue holding that place together.

We booked this hotel through Priceline.com's name your own price.  This which was the first time we had used this service, so I was a little leary about how smooth it would be.  I was impressed with the ease of check-in, the indoor pool, and the rooms were nicely decorated and very clean.  The bed was super comfy too!  The next morning, I walked out of our room and then entire hallway (we were at the other end of the hall from the lobby) was filled with the smells of breakfast.  Gravy & biscuits, sausage, fresh waffles, and the usual cereal/muffin fare.  I would stay here again when in Nashville.

Went last Friday night for a 7:30 reservation. Left outside standing in the rain waiting to 8:30.  We were a party of 6 for dinner. No one seemed to care or would give us a reason for the long wait. Phoned Florintinos in Newtown they told us a table would be ready for us  in 5 min. 
We had an amazing dinner and won't be back to the other place again.
Love Florintiono's thanks again for another wonderful meal!
Very authentic,  we had extreme heat cabbage and three cup chicken. Finally a place with real Chinese food. We loved it. No room for dessert. Have to come back.

Walked in for a pedicure and gel manicure. I was taken right away. The guy who did my nails took his time and really cleaned up my terrible cuticles. They were friendly and reasonably priced ($57 for pedicure and gel manicure). They also have the powder option available too.
After being offered 3 different rooms all with dirty faults and worn mattress we cancelled our reservation and left , I would not recommend staying here !

Everything is covered in pink, including the glittery baked goods. And everything is a bit pricey. It's really a treat yourself type of splurge. It gets crowded and the tables are tiny, so plan accordingly. 

As for the food: 

Cakes- heavy on buttercream frosting, so your experience partly depends on your cake to frosting ratio preference. I prefer less frosting, even though this is a quality buttercream.

Millionaire cake wasn't bad, but the vanilla frosting overwhelmed the more delicious shortbread. The raspberry cake was better as the preserved really stood out.  The passion fruit coconut cake fell short of my expectations and was just unimpressive despite my excitement for such summery flavors. Cookie dough cake was great and packed with cookie dough.  Cookies and cream was too buttercreamy. The earl's court is great and super rich, so definitely for a chocolate lover. I have no complaints about too much rich, dark, chocolate buttercream.

Noncakes - The berry topped cheesecake was gorgeous and yummy. And the coconut cream pie was the silliest I've had. It made up for what it lacked in coconut flavor with its buttery smoothness.

The latte was decent, but not great for the price.

French bread and salted butter may be the best thing on the menu. They're excellent! And my kid loves the buttered noodles.

I've visited with different people, and the staff has always been very friendly and welcoming to us. Bonus points for service.
This place is horrible do not stay I'm here right now and I want out worst room I've ever stayed in and its not even that cheap horrible
Horrible customer service!!  Do yourself a favor and go to Hertz down the street.

We stayed at the Tuscany Tower part of The Peppermill Resort.  A VERY long walk from parking garage to the non-smoking Tuscany Tower via the very smoky main check in area of The Peppermill.  Ash trays at each elevator floor, even though the Tower is supposed to be non-smoking.  Air conditioning did not cool the sleeping area of the room.  The bed was like a slab of concrete.  I expected more from a "newer" 4 star hotel.  The restaurant across from the pool made 3 of us ill, even though we all ate different food.  AVOID this overpriced place!
Just never changes  we tried  this place again after 12 years. Cheep cheep they just want to take every dollar from you.

We were thrilled to come across this tiny little neighborhood gem!  Although you'd never know it based on the location, this is a great little restaurant where they make you feel like family.  We had the calamari, ensalada caprese and shared the pork braciole special and gnocchi.  We finished up by sharing a small plate of cannoli.  Everything was absolutely excellent!  Not to forget, it's BYOB too.  I'm looking forward to going again and bringing friends.

What a unique addition to Indy! I had been wanting to stop by for awhile now but I am sort of a picky eater (I know...I wish I wasn't!) but I finally made my way there to give it a shot. Lucky enough, I found the Lamb patty melt on the menu that was calling to me. Amazing. Such a delicious sandwich with a side of quinoa grits with an egg, bacon and scallions. Coffee was good...I enjoyed the Crunch Berry Cappuccino. What a fun idea!

My one complaint is of course, the no exception rule to asking for an alteration on a dish. As a sometimes picky eater, that may steer me away from returning to try other items on the menu. And the food can be pricey. I left spending much more than I anticipated.

not even happy with this place. here from out of town.  came to see our team play. stupid white girl hostess gave. my table to another party because since we were all black she thought they were with me. REALLY!! so after three loud complaints and LOTS of B.S our game 30 minutes later is on . not happy at all. i will not be back nor will i EVER reccommend:-(

I was skeptical when I walked in since the place is outdated, however I was very happy with the way my pedi and gel nails turned out! My gel looks exactly the same 3 weeks later(besides its grown out) normally at other salons my gel would start to peel up or come off after 2-3 weeks. I didn't have to wait, woman was friendly, and the overall experience was relaxing. I may have found a hidden gem.

Out of town visitor came here based on a colleague's recommendation. The food was amazing! The Salmon was as good as I've had in years. Lots of flavor and cooked perfectly. The pasta was equally as good and the marinara was outstanding.

It is a nice little Mexican restaurant in a strip mall. I thought the decor is colorful and happy. Our waitress was super nice. We got beef and shrimp fajitas. They were really good. The prices are very reasonable. The only bad thing I can think of is that they do. It serve alcohol. All in all, we had a very enjoyable meal there.

So thrilled to find this delightful shop! I purchased a kit with yarn and pattern, but had some problems with the directions. A phone call to the store cleared them up quickly by the helpful lady who answered. Awesome.

I stopped to get a full detail done and I even added on some extras and the price was still amazing. I got in immediately and by the time I took my child to the play park for an hour and came back it was done shiny and ready to go five stars all the way around

I'm not a fan of the bar scene, but if you find me in a bar, it is most likely divey or gay-friendly.  Tabu fits both of these criteria.

I met a friend here who had moved out of town. There was plenty of room at the second floor bar. It was dark, a cool respite from the boiling May heat wave, and half-full of very relaxed patrons. I ordered my favorite non-alcoholic drink of the moment, seltzer with a splash of pineapple juice, and spent the next hour and half catching up with my friend while listening to the somewhat overpowering sound system blast a mix of 80s and current pop. It was really nice to go to a bar where you didn't have to worry about ordering another drink every 5 minutes. Also, although it was described as a gay/straight sports bar, they were playing a Sex & the City marathon on their large screen TV which is way more fun than watching the Phillies, at least for me, a total non-sport fan.

With not much experience with Peruvian food, I was not sure what to expect. Although after taking a look through the dinner menu, I sure had an idea of what I wanted to order.

We started with a few Entradas - Papa a la Huancaina, Terra Sur Calamari and Causa de Pollo. Out of the three, I have to say I enjoyed the latter the best. The calamari was good, not the best I've ever had, and it was so large it looked more like onion rings.

Then we ordered some main dishes, which turned out to be my favorite part of the meal. Between the Ceviche de Pescado y Camaron, Anticuchos de Carne and Paella, I couldn't decide what was the best. The Ceviche was delicious, the steak was seasoned perfectly and the Paella was one of the best I've ever had.

The atmosphere was quiet and more quaint, so probably not the best place to take a large group, but I was in a small group of 4, so it worked well. There was a lot of cool art on the walls, so interesting to look around, but also had an authentic Peruvian feel, which was a nice change from some of my regular haunts. Terra Sur is also a bit off the beaten path, so if you're not looking for it, it may be hard to find without a recommendation.

I'll be back for future visits I'm sure as there are a number of other menu items I'd like to try.
Excellent food and service. Loved that I could order my own turkey burger the way I like it! We will eat here again!!!! Location was easy to find!

This is one of my favourite places in Edmonton to eat! The food is awesome!!! We even had it as a dinner club with work as a payoff as its so delicious.

Depending on the time and day you want to go, I highly recommend making reservations. It is downtown, so parking can sometimes be a bit tricky. You can normally find a place on the south side of the building in the lot.

If you're looking for a business ambience or private meeting room in their library than this is the place to book. If you want a bit more romance for a special event, get a seat close to the fireplace. 

The wait staff is on top of their game and the chefs leave you fully satisfied. They try and incorporate local as well which enhances the freshness. Never ever have I had a bad meal here. 

Although I haven't stayed in the hotel, I hear it's nice and they do specials with the restaurant as well... One day.
Stopped in for takeout, service was fast and pleasant. The price was good for the area. Burger was cooked to order and seasoned well, portions were large. All in all, a decent place. I will return.

I was searching for a good hoagie place rather than doing Primo or Wawa for an evening bowling event at Devon Playdrome.  I found this deli did trays so I ordered a tray and a few other different hoagies to accomdate the group.  The woman who took my order was very helpful in trying to figure out how many sandwiches were needed to feed our total amount of people. The food was very tasty and a definite reason to stop there for a sandwich at any time.  We'll be having more bowling events and will be sure to stop back again the next time or sooner.

Absolutely love this place. Come here atleast once a week during my lunch hour and Frank and his staff are great. Food selection is always interesting and beer selection is great. Excellent food and drink for an even better price. Kudos

The Vietnamese sandwiches here are sooooo good. So good in fact that my boyfriend and I haven't tried anything else on the menu because we can't pass up a barbecue pork Banh Mi sandwich!!!! The sandwiches are fresh tasting and perfect balance of meat and vegetables.  The prices are very reasonable .... If you get a 12" sandwich they throw in a can of soda. The one bummer is that the restaurant shares space with Port O Subs... So it has a low end / fast food vibe.

So delicious. Not fancy,  and decor is still a work Iin progress,  but if you want a delicious burger at reasonable prices,  you have to go to Isaac's. We tried the dry rub wings,  a little roughly cut but delicious. The blue cheese chili fries are to die for. Defiantly going back.

We stopped in here for lunch today and it did not disappoint. Our server was very informative and very welcoming! Our group ordered a mix of things.. some of our favorites were the fried green tomato but (she added the egg and cheese) , the homemade chicken salad sandwich (I ordered this and honestly, the best chicken salad I have ever had. Everything just worked so well together! Great flavor!!), also the blackberry cobbler. The dessert just felt like home. Pure comfort food! We loved the vibe here and it was precious inside! Thanks for the great experience!

I really do love the depot and unfortunately everyone else in Reno does too. The price point is a little high for an every day type of place but the food, drinks and atmosphere are great. It is built in an old train depot as the name implies and is soo cool!

I love the whole concept. We had such a great experience here. The food was delicious. Our waiter was the best. We ordered cheesecake which was even better. I can't wait to come on the day they make cinnamon rolls. We will defiantly be back.
Oh, that tiramisu! So good! Parts of it were a little dry, but I still give it 5 stars. Kind of pricey though. Next time, I'll probably try the cheesecake.

Traditions in place, I want to love this place.  I watched it grow from ground up.  As a longtime native, El Charro was "the place" to take visitors, and to just get yummy Mexican.  This is the 5th time here, with lackluster results.  Salsa, has lost the yummy factor, chili rellenos lacking any real flavor, etc. for beans, even chips!  If the goal is to reach out to the general tourist  public, this is the p,ace.   I will say house margaritas are delicious, and service is spot on.

I had cookies there on my vacation while visiting family.   I think I would have gotten better cookies if I would have gone to Ralph's and picked up a pre made dozen.   I don't live in this city so I guess I cant make a return recommendation.
i woul have given 4 star but their fries are not fried enough.   i wish they would fry it little more, they were very limpy

Ugh, what a disappointment. My husband and I love creole, Cajun cooking and had such high hopes for this place. We had heard great things. The appetizers were great, the bloody Mary's good and the service was fantastic. So why only two stars? The entrees were not good. I had crab ravioli and it was ok. Decent sauce but not real pizazz. My husband had the jambalaya and cat fish and to be honest it seemed as if it was left overs. The jambalaya was horrible-old. The shrimp and sausage were falling apart as of cooked way too long and there was just no flavor. Very disappointing.

The food here is good, not great.  It is very busy during brunch, if you arrive around 1 pm you should have no problem getting a seat in short order.  I ordered the Monte Cristo sandwich, I did appreciate the french toast for the bread but the ham was a standard supermarket lunchmeat.  My dining partner had the breakfast sammy and was happy with his choice.
If you use the Yelp app to secure a place in line, you will check in with the hostess at the time requested and should still have another 20+ minute wait.  Not as reliable as an open table reservation but thankfully they have the option.

Over priced out dated beer selection.  Several of the beers I picked up were over 6 months old and many were over priced. It's packed with rude hipsters d-bags standing around in front of the coolers sampling beer. Talking to the inattentive miserable employees, who act irritated if you ask them a question. Parking is also atrocious. Better options out there

Went here for dinner purposely at an off time.  Highly disappointing experience. The food was ok, the service started out strong then went down the drain. This is on a Tuesday night at around 4:45. . . 

My friend's  ice tea glass sat empty for a long time- the server never came to check to see how our food was until we were practically finished.  I got the wrong dressing but the odds of getting our servers attention was slim to none.  I gave up.  We flagged down the hostess to bring an iced tea refill- several more minutes went by while we were ignored. Finally the hostess walked by and saw the ice tea still hadn't been filled up so she said she would bring it herself. Only after that did the server come back to check to see how everything was. 

There seemed to. E a lot of unhappy customers and food issues. Another table apparently got the wrong food. They had to get their pizza remade etc. it seemed like a rough night. 

Very hit and miss- super inconsistent. Frustrating experience.
Came here opening weekend and was not disappointed after waiting in line for an hour. Matcha is my favorite! I always bring my friends who are in town visiting. They love this place!
Decent service. Food was bland. I'll probably find somewhere else to go next time. It seemed really slow so I'm. It sure if that is indicative of the service or food.

Our reservations were mysteriously cancelled upon arrival, instead of handling the problem, front desk staff tried to turn us away as the hotel was "full." When I demanded we get the rooms that as of two days prior were confirmed, the man behind the counter claimed that was impossible. When I asked to speak to a manager, both gentlemen at the desk claimed to be managers. They then teamed up to make all of this seem like our fault. They kept saying they couldn't help us when we were angry, but what they were really doing was attempting to bully us into leaving through angry and condescending behavior and speech. One was especially bad. He had what seemed to be a violent temper. He had to walk away at one point and compose himself because I wouldn't just accept the fact that our reservations were lost (did I mention my colleague had checked in under the reservation two hours prior?) He was scary, and probably does not need to work with the public. He seemed proud of his behavior, like he could treat me that way because I was powerless. I asked him to call the reservation line to find out what happened. He held the phone to his ear for a while, said he was on hold and that he could call me when he knew what happened. I gave him my cell phone number. I went to our to put down luggage in the rooms they found us that had previously not existed, and when I walked through about ten minutes later to move my car, he was not on the phone nor had I received a call. I asked him what happened and he said they couldn't tell him anything. I told him I didn't appreciate how he had handled the situation, and as I walked away he yelled at me to mention his name when I called to complain. Why would a person say that? No concern or compassion for customers. I think he was mad that made a mistake and had to work to fix it, which is his job. What's really upsetting is that when I called the corporate reservation line later, they said I had had three rooms when the reservation left their system the day before. 

I would never stay here again. I felt like the staff couldn't handle a mix up that most likely happens on occasion. We were not going to leave after our colleague was already able to check in, with no place to go and no idea what happened, and the hotel must not have been "full" if they found us two rooms for the night because we wouldn't leave.

The rooms were below average, but the scary staff is the reason to stay away.

This is the closest grocery store to my home.  The employees are very friendly.  I have never had any issues.  Last night, the cashier actually inspected the bag of spinach, saw that it was wilted, and sent the bagger back to get another bag.

Great customer service.

Had a wonderful dinner at the tavern I had the chicken skewers, they we're delicious, wish they had more veggies in them however. But still they were great! My girlfriend got the Mahi sandwich and said it was perfectly blackened a Cajun tater that paired well with a creamy cucumber garnish, it was all really delicious! I got the house made cocktail "Amerboire".  So good I got 2!! Natalie was our server and she was so helpful and great! Made us feel right at home in Nashville! Can't wait  to come back
Locally owned shop for tires which are critical for cars! Wish they had more brand options in house but they can order you almost any tire you like. Local folks doing good work at decent prices.

This place had slightly above-average Americanized Chinese food, with even a few nods to real Chinese cookin' thrown in (veggies w/ oyster sauce, salt baked squid).  Some dishes are good (hot pot), some are not (Szechuan anything... really just icky sweet & sour sauce with a dash of hot sauce & ketchup).  However, if I want takeaway food I'll order out from my local place.  If I'm going to walk all the way to C-town, I want the real deal.

We used BAS for a move-out cleanup.  We lived in a row house for five years, had a great landlord and wanted to leave the place cleaner than we found it.  Based on other reviews, we called BAS Cleaning Company.  They were spectacular--four super hardworking and fastidious people did everything you would want a cleaning service to do, and more.  BAS's owner Abdul stopped by a few times to see how things were going.  Aside from cleaning, the crew was friendly, asked questions when appropriate.  The price was fair.  I was 100% satisfied.  And yes, the house was cleaner than when we moved in!

I absolutely love the french toast and the baked eggs. Both are baked in loaf pans, and you get a thick slice (imagine something like a meatloaf...and they give you a slice that is about 3 inches thick). The eggs also come with the kinda of toast you would expect from a bakery and some fruit. 

Lunch is good too, but I would get breakfast 100% of the time if they served it all day. 

My only complaint on this cafe is that it feels very much like you are in Clayton...the clientele clearly has money. I've never seen anyone just hanging out with their computer and taking advantage of the free wifi. It's more of a place where sophisticated people go to enjoy a leisurely lunch. 

I wish the CWE location hadn't closed...it had the people and the food I wanted, and camping out for hours with a laptop felt normal there. 

The Clayton location does have a small patio area, and I am impressed they went to the trouble to put outlets into the columns. I was also there once around 2 pm, and they were dragging a rack of old bread out to throw it away (seriously...why isn't it being donated!)...the staff person looked at me, my companion and one other woman sitting outside and told us we could take as much home for free as we wanted since it was going into the dumpster. Not sure if that is normal or if we just hit a nice employee on the right day.

Being new to the area I don't know about many places so I'm always excited to try a new venue.

I was here during the happy hrs of 5-7pm. I ordered the mango martini which was actually good..the peach wasn't that great.

Being broke I opted for the half off appetizer specials.
-Coconut Shrimp
-Chicken wings
-Catfish tenders
-Cornbread

For some reason, all the items tasted "not fresh". The shrimp was chewy..tasted like pre-cooked shrimps that were then fried in the coconut batter. Def did not taste like it was made fresh when i ordered it.

Cornbread...DEF NOT FRESHLY made..tasted like yesterday's cornbread.

Basically everything I ate was not freshly made.  I understand that I was eating on the "half off" special but geez I've ate at other places with "half off" menus and the food were freshly made and delicious.

Anyway, I was not impressed. I expected something way better...oh well, onto my next venue.
They had a parking lot right next door which i was very excited to see. Its a large place and I liked the decor...hopefully they improve on the quality of the food.

Not really sure what people expect from this place. It's a cheaper brand of hotels in not the greatest part of town. For what it is a CHEAP hotel located conveniently by the airport it's pretty good, it's attached to a 24 hour ihop and right next to a bar. Staff is nice, rooms are decent not great. As far as value for dollar this place is great.

We had a great experience today at Burger Up! Our server David was awesome. He realized immediately that we were kind of in a hurry, so he took our order quickly. He was super friendly and made sure the girls and I were well taken care of!! 
This is why Burger Up is one of our favorite restaurants!

We were really surprised about this place! We had no idea what to expect, we didn't realize it is a Vietnamese restauaurant. But we love all Asian food & decided to try it. Plus, they have tons of Boba drinks to choose from - YUM. The place was pretty busy, even on an off time of day. And I always think if I'm in an ethnic restaurant and there are a lot of customers of that ethnicity, then it must be pretty good.  We both really liked it a lot!!!!!

Great lunch!!  We saw all the people eating here so we decided it must be a good place to go!! The food was amazing !! We took other's advice and tried it all!! Mac and cheese was great so was the banana pudding.  I had the Chilean sandwich and would skip the bun and the slaw next time. The French fries were amazing !!
